update.description:
Depends on pull request #163

Added a TransformController class for handling the logic that applies node transforms based on mouse movements.

See the `transfom_control` example for demo:

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/2435446385-transform.png)
update.title: Add Transform Controller for translating, rotating, and scaling nodes

pull_request.title: Add Transform Controller for translating, rotating, and scaling nodes

pullrequest.title: Add Transform Controller for translating, rotating, and scaling nodes

content.raw:
yeah in the `transform_control` example, you can currently toggle between global and local space transformation by pressing `g`. 

I have not implemented translation or scaling in XY / YZ / XZ planes though. It’s on my todo list.
content.html:
yeah in the transform_control example, you can currently toggle between global and local space transformation by pressing g.

I have not implemented translation or scaling in XY / YZ / XZ planes though. It’s on my todo list.

pull_request.title: Add Transform Controller for translating, rotating, and scaling nodes

pullrequest.title: Add Transform Controller for translating, rotating, and scaling nodes

content.raw: disabled rotation in all axes in [04a064a](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/04a064a24e94c83c70b67a699dc69b4fd259955d). User should no longer be able to interact with the gray circle in rotation mode.
content.html: disabled rotation in all axes in 04a064a. User should no longer be able to interact with the gray circle in rotation mode.

pull_request.title: Add Transform Controller for translating, rotating, and scaling nodes

pullrequest.title: Add Transform Controller for translating, rotating, and scaling nodes

content.raw: This is very nice. Are there plans to also support moving and rotating the object in the global coordinate frame? For example, after I rotate an object I may want to move it on the global XY plane and not in the local XY plane.
content.html: This is very nice. Are there plans to also support moving and rotating the object in the global coordinate frame? For example, after I rotate an object I may want to move it on the global XY plane and not in the local XY plane.

windows build failed due to an internal compiler error.

Added a GizmoVisual class where the translate, rotate, and scale visuals are created, and also a TransformController class for handling the logic that applies node transforms based on mouse movements.

See the `transfom_control` example for demo:

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/2435446385-transform.png)
